chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Willie T Boyd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
** Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid)  Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days - PD A Komp.   Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May Not have contact with victim unless otherwise permitted by the court.  Review hearing on 3/26/15 @ 9 a.m.  Probation and Parole to provide written report by 3/23/15.  Report shall include whether deft has been complaint with all orders.

Amended

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Angela Komp.  Case is resolved.  State amends to misd. operate a motor vehicle w/o owner's consent/joyriding.  Deft pleads guilty to the amended charge; found guilty by the Court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for one year.  RH set for 3/26/15 @ 9am.  P&P to provide a written report to the court.  If revoked, deft requests credit for three days.
Scheduling Order

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Angela Komp.  Acknowledge receipt of info.  Waive reading.  Plea of not guilty entered.  FPT 9/25/14 @ 9:30am, JT 10/14/14 @ 9am.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Angela Komp. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 3 for arraignment on 8-19-14 @ 1:15pm. Information filed. Bond continued.
